observation: Home - Alaska Municipal League  About AML AML Members Associates Membership Associates Directory Affiliates Board of Directors Donate Partners Contact Events Annual Local Government Conference Affiliate Events Alaska Infrastructure Development Symposium Summer Legislative Conference Conference of Young Alaskans Past Events Shared Services Financial Success Alaska Municipal Financial Solutions (AMFS) AML Investment Pool (AMLIP) Sales Tax Collection Service (STCS) Online Sales Tax Liquidity-Management with cashVest Effective Operations AML Joint Insurance Association Online Remote Notary Cybersecurity Solutions Unemployment Insurance Workplace Misconduct with Workshield Strategic Hiring Employee Benefits Alaska Municipal Health Trust (AMHT) Nationwide Retirement Solutions Professional Development Academy Live Healthy Discount Program Mental Health Wellness Member Resources Municipalities Classifieds Calendar Newly Elected Officials Public Health Publications Resources Projects and Funding AKFederalFunding.org Alaska Energy Hub AK Transportation Funding Opportunity Hub Alaska Water Infrastructure Financial Navigation Center Coastal Resilience Advocacy Eight Stars of Gold Resolutions Legislative Tracker Legislative Resources Legislative Communications Leaning Local Cities of Opportunity AkDU’S AND DON’TS If I Were Mayor Essay Contest Select Page AML is a nonprofit, nonpartisan, statewide membership organization Creating a number of programs to assist with local governance capacity and best practices. Learn about AML Our mission is to strengthen Alaska’s local governments Building consensus and partnerships to address Alaska’s challenges. Proudly serving Alaska’s 165 cities and boroughs Providing services, education, training, and resources to support local government. Previous Next 1 2 3 We envision a future of thriving communities led by healthy local governments.  Conferences, workshops and events to bring best practices to members, provide professional development, and support local governments. See the Calendar  Read about updates from cities and boroughs – ordinances and resolutions that are making a difference. Learn More  Shared services are offered to strengthen local governments who may either not have access to or the capacity to manage them on their own. Benefits for Members  A majority of the 165 members, cities and boroughs across the state, depend on AML to advocate on their behalf, and to amplify their voices.
